headline: Ford will raise the sticker price on cars imported from Mexico. It just said it didn’t expect significant US price hikes
summary: Ford is hiking the sticker prices for the three US models it imports from Mexico by up to $2,000 each, just days after executives said they didn’t expect significant increases in industrywide car prices this year.

headline: This Week In Electric Vehicles - EVDANCE Unveils Advanced Smart Charger For Home Use
summary: EVDANCE has introduced the FLUX 40A Smart EV Charger, aiming to enhance home charging with advanced features. This next-gen charger offers faster Level 2 charging capabilities, improved safety measures, and intelligent app integration, allowing users to remotely control and schedule their charging sessions. headline: Exclusive-Ford hikes prices on Mexico-produced models, citing tariffs
summary: DETROIT (Reuters) -Ford Motor has hiked prices on three of its Mexico-produced models effective May 2, becoming one of the first major automakers to adjust sticker prices following U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs.  Prices on the Mustang Mach-E electric SUV, Maverick pickup and Bronco Sport will increase by as much as $2,000 on some models, according to a notice sent to dealers, which was reviewed by Reuters.  Ford earlier this week said Trump's trade war would add about $2.5 billion in costs for 2025, but it expects to reduce that exposure by around $1 billion.

Ford earlier this week said Trump's trade war would add about $2.5 billion in costs for 2025, but it expects to reduce that exposure by around $1 billion.

headline: Trump Eases Auto Tariffs, Auto Makers 'Welcome And Appreciate' The Move
summary: President Donald Trump eased auto tariffs with an executive order and proclamation on Tuesday While not a permanent rollback, the changes are intended to give U.S. auto companies "a little bit of a break" Auto companies like Ford and Stellantis say they "welcome and appreciate" the move, which came on Trump's 100th day in office President Donald Trump signed a series of executive orders and proclamations to ease auto tariffs on April 29.
